tip_text: Wildcat Bluff is a must see! Great hiking trails not too far from city center.
The Riverwalk is great, but be careful if you're a solo female traveller. People target the area because it's a known tourist spot.
Miami has the BEST Cuban food, if you've never tried ropa vieja before, Miami is the best place to go for it.
Bob's Diner is amazing, if you're staying in Camden or Philly, you've got to go!
The art scene in Santa Fe is fantastic. There are so many local artists selling their work throughout the city.
Cafe Lafitte and Oz are two of the best gay bars I've ever been to. My friends and I had such a great time!
I came here on a business trip and stayed near the airport, which usually makes me feel unsafe, but the hotel staff was so helpful, they gave me great directs everyday of where I needed to go.
We stayed in the Boise National Forest and had a great trip. Clean, safe facilities and a lot of nice trails.
The Four Way Soul Food Restaurant was one of the best meals I've ever had!

Since it's so well known for the large Mormon community, my girlfriend and I were pleasantly surprised by how welcoming and gay-friendly people were when we stayed in Salt Lake City. We stayed at Desoto Tudor, the owners were kind and, bonus, they have cats!
The Mohawk-Hudson trail is a great trail for beginners or if you're taking small kids since it's paved the whole way.
Center City is really well populated, it seems like there's always someone around even at night, so I felt safe going to dinner later than I usually would.
Do not go out alone at night, Augusta is not that safe and it's not worth the risk.
Be careful going to Springfield right now, they are having high rates of COVID.
We were in the city for their Joining Hearts party in July, so much fun and all to fundraise for HIV/AIDS services. Truly a supportive, incredible community in Atlanta.
The Atlanta Breakfast Club was amazing. Good prices and incredible food!
A League of Her Own is a great lesbian bar worth checking out if you're in the city.
There is so much to do if you're travelling alone, and the benefit of a big city is you can go out later without having to worry about getting a bus/taxi/etc. back to your hotel.
Tacos Pericos is a great taqueria, but there's hardly ever any parking, so I'd recommend walking from the main downtown area.
Prost on Mississippi Ave is a great beer garden and the foodtrucks next door are amazing.

I went to Portland on my own and felt really safe everywhere I went. The public transit is really easy to manage as well, though be careful that you watch for your bus stop, they don't call out every stop.
The Thursdsay night farmers market is a must-see, great food and music downtown every Thrusday.

Henry Cowell State Park has some great trails, there is a small flat loop where you can see some redwoods if you're looking for a shorter hike, and some long hikes you can take farther into the mountains.
Sutro Baths and Lands End are some great places to hike without having to travel too far out of the city.
Be careful around the Boardwalk, it is a target for pickpocketers.
The Rosicrucian Museum is a weird museum in the middle of San Jose, right by the Rose Garden. I had a great time with my friends on our trip, it's odd but I would recommend.
In hac habitasse platea dictumst.
Fort Lauderdale has the biggest LGBT population in Florida so anywhere in the city is a safe space to visit.
